Name: March Forth and Giggle
Description: March 1 kicks off the month—so if humor had a marching band, what instrument would it play, and would it stay in step or trip over its own punchline?

Name: Spring Training for Jokes
Description: As baseball gears up for spring training, do jokes need preseason workouts too, or should they just stretch their setup and hope for a home run?

Name: Weather Forecast: 100% Chance of Chuckles
Description: Early March weather changes by the hour—should humor come with a forecast, or is unpredictability the whole point of the laugh storm?

Name: Leap-Year Leftovers
Description: If February had an extra day last year, do we owe March an extra joke this year to keep the calendar’s sense of humor balanced?

Name: March Forth Command
Description: On March 4 ('March forth!'), if you ordered your jokes to march forth, would they advance bravely or retreat into awkward silence?

Name: Daylight Saving Snickers
Description: With clocks about to spring forward, do punchlines lose an hour of sleep, and is that why they sometimes feel a little groggy?

Name: Lion or Lamb Laughs
Description: Since March supposedly comes in like a lion and out like a lamb, should your humor roar boldly at the start of the month and gently baa by the end?

Name: Green With Envy (of Better Jokes)
Description: As everything starts turning green for St. Patrick’s season, is it okay for a joke to feel a little green with envy if another one gets the bigger laugh?

Name: Ides of March Anticipation
Description: Before the Ides even arrive, should humor watch its back in early March, or is betrayal only funny when it’s part of the punchline?

Name: Mud Season Humor
Description: When March melts into muddy chaos, is the best comedy clean and crisp—or delightfully messy like your shoes after a walk?
